pepper.language.utils.helper_functions module¶

pepper.language.utils.helper_functions.dbp_query(q, base_url, format=u'application/json')[source]¶
Parameters:
  • q – query for DBpedia
  • base_url – URL to connect to DBpedia
  • format – format for query, typically json
Returns:

json with DBpedia responses
pepper.language.utils.helper_functions.fix_pronouns(pronoun, self)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • pronoun – personal ronoun which is said in the sentence
  • self – Utterance object from which we can get the speaker and lexicon
Returns:

disambiguated first or second person pronoun

In the case of third person pronouns - guesses or asks questions * plural *

pepper.language.utils.helper_functions.get_lexname_in_tree(word, forest)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • word – word for which we want a WordNe lexname
  • forest – parsed forest of the sentence, to extract the POS tag
Returns:

lexname of the word

https://wordnet.princeton.edu/documentation/lexnames5wn

pepper.language.utils.helper_functions.get_pos_in_tree(tree, word)[source]¶

This function extracts POS tag of a word from the parsed syntax tree :param tree: syntax tree gotten from initial CFG parsing :param word: word whose POS tag we want :return: POS tag of the word

pepper.language.utils.helper_functions.get_triple_element_type(element, forest)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • element – text of one element from the triple
  • forest – parsed tree
Returns:

dictionary with semantic types of the element or sub-elements
pepper.language.utils.helper_functions.get_uris(string)[source]¶
Parameters:string – string which we are querying for
Returns:set of URIS from DBpedia for the queried string
pepper.language.utils.helper_functions.get_word_type(word, forest)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • word – one word from triple element
  • forest – parsed syntax tree
Returns:

semantic type of word
pepper.language.utils.helper_functions.lemmatize(word, tag=u'')[source]¶

This function uses the WordNet lemmatizer :param word: word to be lemmatized :param tag: POS tag of word :return: word lemma

pepper.language.utils.helper_functions.lexicon_lookup(word, typ=None)[source]¶

Look up and return features of a given word in the lexicon. :param word: word which we’re looking up :param typ: type of word, if type is category then returns the lexicon entry and the word type :return: lexicon entry of the word

pepper.language.utils.helper_functions.trim_dash(triple)[source]¶
Parameters:triple – a set with three elements (subject, object, complement)
Returns:clean triple with extra dashes removed
